comments:
-- Error Log --
Date: Fri Jun 08 10:16:39 BST 2007
Message: Internal error validating repository
Severity: Error
Plugin ID: org.eclipse.mylar
Stack Trace:
java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: javax/xml/rpc/ServiceException
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraClientManager.createServer(JiraClientManager.java:171)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.core.JiraClientManager.testConnection(JiraClientManager.java:151)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.JiraClientFacade.validateServerAndCredentials(JiraClientFacade.java:146)
at org.eclipse.mylar.internal.jira.ui.wizards.JiraRepositorySettingsPage$JiraValidator.run(JiraRepositorySettingsPage.java:133)
at org.eclipse.mylar.tasks.ui.wizards.AbstractRepositorySettingsPage$19.run(AbstractRepositorySettingsPage.java:1149)
at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)

Please try to update Mylar again making sure that you got all components by using Software Updates -> Search for new features... instead of "search for updates".  Let us know if that resolves it.

This could be a duplicate of bug 191692.
I'm running 3.3RC2; if I search on the normal Europa sites I just see the 'Trac' connector for Mylar.  Do I need a specific update site for Mylar?

If you run the search and see that JIRA is installed this is likely another problem.  

Richard: I assume that you're using the Europa-based install of Mylar?

Eugene: have you seen this before?  That class should be coming from the xmlrpc libraries, so I wonder if there is some conflict in another library coming from Europa.

Yes, I installed everything from Europa when I set up 3.3RC2.  However today I did an update of everything, after which the Mylar Jira connector stopped working.  Maybe I have got some components intended for 3.3RC3 or RC4.  

I uninstalled Mylar from the 'Manage Configuration' window; but I see the mylar plugin jars are still in the plugins directory.

Could be some unrepeatable update mess; I'll probably start again with a clean RC4 and see what happens.

I did notice that the manifest in the Jira plugin contains:

Bundle-ClassPath: .,lib-axis/axis-1.3.jar,lib-axis/commons-discovery-0
 .2.jar,lib-axis/jaxrpc.jar,lib-axis/saaj.jar,lib-axis/wsdl4j-1.5.1.ja
 r

After the update this morning, there is no lib-axis in my eclipse/configuration directory; lib-axis was in the previous version that I used heavily (3.3M7).  

Maybe one of the recent updates has disposed of lib-axis.

(In reply to comment #4)
> Yes, I installed everything from Europa when I set up 3.3RC2.  
> However today I did an update of everything, after which the Mylar Jira
> connector stopped working.  Maybe I have got some components intended 
> for 3.3RC3 or RC4.
> I uninstalled Mylar from the 'Manage Configuration' window; but I see the
> mylar plugin jars are still in the plugins directory.

You may want to make sure Manage Configuration don't show any Mylar features and then manually delete plugins hat hasn't been gracefully uninstalled.

> I did notice that the manifest in the Jira plugin contains:
> Bundle-ClassPath: .,lib-axis/axis-1.3.jar,lib-axis/commons-discovery-0
>  .2.jar,lib-axis/jaxrpc.jar,lib-axis/saaj.jar,lib-axis/wsdl4j-1.5.1.ja
>  r
> After the update this morning, there is no lib-axis in my eclipse/configuration
> directory; lib-axis was in the previous version that I used heavily (3.3M7).  

Those jars are inside of org.eclipse.mylar.jira.core_*.jar and class javax/xml/rpc/ServiceException in one of those jars.
So, please try to reinstall Mylar from scratch after cleaning your environment.

By the waym do you have other features like WTP installed from that Europa update site?

I was able to reproduce this without any other Europa plug-ins installed, so marking as a duplciate of bug 191692.  Not yet sure what changes in the JIRA connector or packaging could have caused this.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 191692 ***
